section.title: Development Prerequisites
section.para: In order to develop Mindquarry, you need:

listitem.para: A Java Development Kit, Version 1.5 or higher
Subversion 1.3 or higher (a Subversion client is sufficient)

section.para: Additional tools for Mindquarry development that are not neccessary, but ease the development process are:

listitem.para: A good editor for Javascript and CSS

section.para: A good combination that has proven success in Mindquarry's development team is the Eclipse IDE with the Subclipse Plugin, oXygen XML Plugin and JSEclipse Javascript Editor Plugin.

section.title: Getting Mindquarry's Source Code
section.para: Mindquarry consists of many small projects (Maven modules), each with its own Subversion repository.

The easiest way to check out Mindquarry's source code is to check out the Mindquarry Meta-System, which includes all Mindquarry projects as externals. This includes everything neccessary to run the Mindquarry Webapplication.

appendix.title: Further Reading
appendix.para: Further valuable information can be found in the Mindquarry Collaboration Server Architecture Documentation which explains the main building blocks and cocepts behind Mindquarry.
If you are interested in becomming a permanent member of the Mindquarry team and join us as a comitter, the Mindquarry Development Process document might be of interest for you.
